00040 #ifndef _soundlistener_h
00041 #define _soundlistener_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "vector3.h"
00045 
00046 namespace cAudio
00047 {
00048     class IListener;
00049 }
00050 
00051 namespace phys
00052 {
00053     class SoundManager;
00054     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00055     /// @class SoundListener
00056     /// @headerfile soundlistener.h
00057     /// @brief This is the listener class used for 3D sound.
00058     /// @details This is the listener class used for determining how 3D sound is played.
00059     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00060     class PHYS_LIB SoundListener
00061     {
00062         protected:
00063             cAudio::IListener* AudioListener;
00064         public:
00065             /// @brief Class constructor.  Internal use only.
00066             /// @details The Class constructor.  This is an internal function and shouldn't be called manually.
00067             /// @param Listener Pointer to the internal listener.
00068             SoundListener(cAudio::IListener* Listener);
00069             /// @brief Class destructor.
00070             /// @details The class destructor.
00071             ~SoundListener();
00072             /// @brief Sets the listener position.
00073             /// @details Sets the listeners position.
00074             /// @param Position The new position for the listener.
00075             void SetPosition(Vector3 Position);
00076             /// @brief Sets the direction the listener is facing.
00077             /// @details Sets the direction the listener is facing.
00078             /// @param Direction The new direction for the listener.
00079             void SetDirection(Vector3 Direction);
00080             /// @brief Sets the up direction for the listener.
00081             /// @details Sets the direction that is up relative to the orientation of the listener.  Default: +Y
00082             /// @param Up The new upward vector to be used by the listener.
00083             void SetUpVector(Vector3 Up);
00084             /// @brief Sets the velocity of the listener.
00085             /// @details Sets the listeners velocity, for use in determining doppler effects.
00086             /// @param Velocity The new velocity for the listener.
00087             void SetVelocity(Vector3 Velocity);
00088             /// @brief Sets the master volume for all sources heard by this listener.
00089             /// @details This function will scale the volume for all sources heard by this listener by the
00090             /// amount provided.
00091             /// @param Volume The amount by which to scale all sound sources heard.
00092             void SetMasterVolume(Real Volume);
00093             /// @brief Moves the listener to a new location.
00094             /// @details This function will set a new position and velocity of the listener.
00095             /// @param Position The new position of the listener.
00096             void Move(Vector3 Position);
00097             /// @brief Gets the current position of the listener.
00098             /// @details This function will get the current position of the listener.
00099             /// @return Returns the current position of the listener.
00100             Vector3 GetPosition();
00101             /// @brief Gets the current direction of the listener.
00102             /// @details This function will get the current direction of the listener.
00103             /// @return Returns the current direction of the listener.
00104             Vector3 GetDirection();
00105             /// @brief Sets the upward orientation of the listener.
00106             /// @details Sets which direction is up for the listener
00107             /// @return Returns the current up orientation of the listener.
00108             Vector3 GetUpVector();
00109             /// @brief Gets the current velocity of the listener.
00110             /// @details This function will get the current velocity of the listener.
00111             /// @return Returns the current velocity of the listener.
00112             Vector3 GetVelocity();
00113             /// @brief Gets the master volume used to scale sound sources.
00114             /// @details This function will get the master volume, which is used to scale the volume
00115             /// of all sound sources heard by this listener.
00116             /// @return Returns the current scale used for adjusting the volume of all sources heard by
00117             /// this listener.
00118             Real GetMasterVolume();
00119             /// @brief Sets the scale to be used by the manager for this listener.
00120             /// @details This function will set the engines scale for use with sounds.
00121             /// Internally the engine assumes all units are in meters.  If that is not the
00122             /// case then this function should be called to set the scale.
00123             /// @param Meters The amount of meters that are in one unit of your games scale.
00124             void SetMetersPerUnit(Real Meters);
00125             /// @brief Gets the scale used by the manager for this listener.
00126             /// @details This function will get the amount of meters per unit used in your
00127             /// game/simulation scale.  The engine assumes you use meters, so default is 1.0.
00128             /// @return Returns the amount of meters per unit in your scale.
00129             Real GetMetersPerUnit();
00130     };
00131 }
00132 
00133 #endif
